page.title: 16CHILWELL. Area History.
page.content: We believe that the first settlement at Chilwell was after the Romans left Britain although we think that the Romans settled at nearby Stapleford and used the Chilwell area for farming. The first real settlers to build a small settlement were Anglo Saxons who invaded Britain after 700 AD and may have come to this area by 750 AD. It is more than likely that an Anglo Saxon gave his name to this settlement. Old English Wel- Clear Water, Chiefs name Chil. Chilwell is mentioned in the { {Domesday Book} as being part of Beeston.
